newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-HILL RESIGNS AS FULHAM CHAIRMAN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HILL RESIGNS AS FULHAM CHAIRMAN.

text.p: Jimmy Hill, one of the more outspoken and colourful characters in English soccer, announced on Friday he was standing down as chairman of Fulham after 10 years in charge.
The London club have just won promotion to the second division, and Hill said: "Throughout my career I've always believed you should get out when on top, which is what I'm doing."

Speaking on BBC Radio, Hill, 70, a well known television personality, said his decision to step down heralded: "A new chapter in the story of this unique club. The end of an era," but he added it was "a happy day."

Fulham last played in the top division n 1968 and have faced extinction several times in the last few years as their Craven Cottage ground next to the River Thames in fashionable west London became a target for property developers.
But the club are about to regain ownership of the ground for the first time in 20 years and their future looks healthier than it has done for many years.
